commit_file.pattern_help: You need to specify the pattern of the files included in the zip that will be imported, "eg": **/*.strings
commit_file.new_document_warning: The changes will create a new file.
commit_file.existing_document_warning: The changes will be applied to the already existing file.

commit_file.peek_help: This action will have no effects on your project.
commit_file.upload_help: After choosing a file you will be able to preview the changes on your project

sync.title: Sync
sync.text: Update the list of strings in Accent, removing ones missing in the file and adding new ones.The sync is always done in the main language.New strings and removed strings changes will be reflected in all translated languages.

merge.title: Add translations
merge.text: Merge translations present in the uploaded file with strings existing in Accent. The add translations is usually done when you translate the string directly in your project to save some times for reviewers.

mistakes.title: Common mistakes
mistakes.item_1: Export Accent files locally before a sync. This will force you to resolve conflicts locally and potentially override reviewed texts or adding removed strings.
mistakes.item_2: Sync a translated language (not your main language). This will effectively generates conflicts for all your keys, changing the text of the main language for your translated language.
mistakes.item_3: Sync one file per language. The purpose of the "file" in Accent is to be translated in X languages. Sync your main language and let the translated languages be translated in the UI.

conflict_item.correct_error_text: Failed to correct the conflict. Try again later.
conflict_item.uncorrect_error_text: Failed to uncorrect the conflict. Try again later.

versions_list.empty_text: Versionning enables you to review/export/sync translations independantly from your main project. This means that supporting previous versions of your app will be as easy as adding new features!

documents_list.empty_text: Files are the actual listing of your project’s main language files. Add them here or from the CLI and keep them in sync with your project.

item.path_help: Used to scope your strings. The path will be used to export all your languages (en/path.format, fr/path.format)

project_activity.rollback_confirm: Are you sure you want to rollback this activity? You cannot undo a rollback.

stats_text.conflict_on_slave: New conflict reflected in another language

action_explanation.add_to_version: When a user creates a version, the string is copied as a versioned string. The string will remain untouched by the "main" version
action_explanation.version_new: When a user creates a version, the string is copied as a versioned string. The string will remain untouched by the "main" version
action_explanation.create_version: When a user freeze the state of all strings to tag it with a version. Used to maintain multiple versions of the same app in parallel.
action_explanation.conflict_on_corrected: When the uploaded text is different than the last synced text and the last synced text is different than the current text. This happens if the text has been touched by a user in Accent. It is uselful to identify a conflict that is caused by a difference in a sync and the modified version in Accent.
action_explanation.conflict_on_proposed: When the uploaded text is different than the last uploaded text and the last synced text is equal to the current text. This happens if the text has not been touched by a user in Accent. It is uselful to identify a conflict that is only caused by a sync and not a human intervention.
action_explanation.conflict_on_slave: When the activity "conflict on proposed" or "conflict on corrected" happens on a string, the matching keys in other languages apply this activity. The goal of this activity is to flag a change of meaning in the main language in the translations. The string will be flagged as "in review"
action_explanation.correct_all: When all the strings are manually marked as reviewed.
action_explanation.correct_conflict: When a string is manually marked as reviewed.
action_explanation.batch_correct_conflict: When multiple strings were marked as reviewed in a short lapse of time.
action_explanation.document_delete: When a file has been deleted.
action_explanation.batch_merge: When strings are updated with new translations from file uploads. This applies the same logic as the sync activity but without removing strings.
action_explanation.merge: When strings are updated with new translations from a file upload. This applies the same logic as the sync activity but without removing strings.
action_explanation.merge_on_corrected: When the uploaded text is different than the last synced text and the last synced text is different than the current text. This happens if the text has been touched by a user in Accent. It is uselful to identify a conflict that is caused by a difference in the sync upload and the modified version in Accent.
action_explanation.merge_on_proposed: When the uploaded text is different than the last synced text and the last synced text is equal to the current text. This happens if the text has not been touched by a user in Accent. It is uselful to identify a conflict that is only caused by the sync upload and not a human intervention.
action_explanation.merge_on_corrected_force: When the uploaded text is different than the last synced text and the last synced text is different than the current text. This happens if the text has been touched by a user in Accent. It is uselful to identify a conflict that is caused by a difference in the sync upload and the modified version in Accent.
action_explanation.merge_on_proposed_force: When the uploaded text is different than the last synced text and the last synced text is equal to the current text. This happens if the text has not been touched by a user in Accent. It is uselful to identify a conflict that is only caused by the sync upload and not a human intervention.
action_explanation.remove: When the synced file does not contain the key.
action_explanation.new: When the synced file contains a key that is not present in the file.
action_explanation.renew: When the synced file contains a key that was previously removed.
action_explanation.new_slave: When a new language is added to the project.
action_explanation.rollback: When a user manually rollback an activity.
action_explanation.sync: When a document is synced with a file.
action_explanation.batch_sync: When documents are synced with files.
action_explanation.uncorrect_all: When all the strings are manually put back in review.
action_explanation.uncorrect_conflict: When the string is manually put back in review.
action_explanation.batch_update: When multiple strings are manually updated by someone.
action_explanation.update: When the string is manually updated by someone.
action_explanation.update_proposed: When the synced text is the same as the current text but different than the last synced text. The only thing this activity does is make sure that the reference of the last synced text is updated. This does not affect the string’s text.

action_text.add_to_version: froze the string in a version
action_text.version_new: added the string to a version
action_text.conflict_on_slave: ’s sync activity created a conflict reflected in another language
action_text.uncorrect_conflict: put a string back to review
action_text.uncorrect_all: put all strings back to review

label_text.conflict_on_proposed: The text is still in review and is now:
label_text.conflict_on_slave: The text has been moved to review and is now:

machine_translations.title: Machine translations
machine_translations.text: Add a valid configuration to enable translating directly in the Review page. You can also translate your project’s file as well as arbirtary files that you upload on Accent.
machine_translations.use_platform_label: Use the platform config if available
machine_translations.config_key_help_present: Config key has been set, but the value will never be exposed via the API.
machine_translations.config_key_help_not_present: Once saved, the config key will never be shown.

prompts.title: AI Assistant
prompts.help: Instructions will be available on all string inputs to help you improve your content. The clearer the instructions you give to the assistant, to better the output will be.
prompts.use_platform_label: Use the platform config if available
prompts.config_key_help_present: Config key has been set, but the value will never be exposed via the API.
prompts.config_key_help_not_present: Once saved, the config key will never be shown.
prompts.delete_confirm: Are you sure you want to delete this instruction?

delete_form.title: Danger zone
delete_form.delete_project_text: Once you delete a project, there is no going back.
delete_form.delete_project_confirm: Are you sure you want to delete this project? This action cannot be undone.

form.unsupported_logo_type: Only SVG files are supported as project logo.

lock_file_operations.text_1: When the file operations are locked, syncing and adding translations will be disabled.

jipt.title: Just In Place Translations
jipt.integration_help: This steps will walk you throught the setup you need to have in your project to translate your strings in your browser, inside your project.
jipt.demo_help: See a static HTML page that renders the first string of your project in different context. The Accent live integration can be seen at the bottom of the page. Note that the live example use your real project’s data.
jipt.add_language_title: Add the pseudo language to your project
jipt.add_language_image_1: Here is a language like you already have in your project:
jipt.add_language_image_2: Here is the pseudo language named "accent" that act as a normal translation in your project:
jipt.pseudo_language_text: The Accent script parses the DOM for strings that match the Just In Place Translations export. Go in the "Files" section to export the file or use the CLI to add the pseudo language to your project.
jipt.use_language_text: By switching to the Accent language using your favorite framework i18n tool, the page will display the strings in the pseudo language files and the Accent script will replace those by the strings in Accent. It will also bind click event on the elements so that you can select strings directly in your app and edit them via Accent.

api_token.title: API tokens
api_token.text_1: With this token, you can make authentified calls to Accent’s API. All tokens have the 'bot' permissions: sync and add translations. You can specifiy custom permissions to have more fine grained tokens across your project. Set the token as ACCENT_API_KEY in your GitHub actions workflows to be authenticated using accent-cli.
api_token.revoke_confirm: Are you sure you want to revoke the token? This operation can’t be reverted.

user_token.title: Your personal token
user_token.text_1: You can also use your personal token to make API call as yourself. Beware, this token is global for all your project.
user_token.text_shell: You can set a global environment variable named ACCENT_API_KEY on your shell (bash, zsh, fish, etc) to be authenticated when you use accent-cli.

badges.title: Badges
badges.text: Can be embedded in markdown files or displayed on a web page to show public stats for a given project.

collaborators.admin_text: Can add languages, update the project and add/remove collaborators.
collaborators.developer_text: Can make file operations: Sync, add translations and preview those operations in the UI.
collaborators.owner_text: With the same roles as the admin, the owners are people who the project belongs to.
collaborators.reviewer_text: Can do every tasks except those listed in the above roles. Review, update strings, comments, etc.
collaborators.translator_text: Translate strings and make updates on documents. The translator is not included in the review process.
collaborators.title: Collaborators

integrations.title: Service & integrations
integrations.help: Services are pre-built integrations that perform certain actions when events occur on Accent. More info ->

aws_s3.text: Upload your files in Amazon Web Services S3 to serve them directly in your application

azure_storage_container.text: Upload your files in Azure Storage Container to serve them directly in your application

slack.text: Post your project’s notifications in Slack

project_comments_list.no_comments: No comments on any strings yet. You can comment on any string to provide context for a translator or to discuss on the content of the string.
project_comments_list.title: Conversation

version_create_form.title: New version
version_create_form.text: Creating a version makes a snapshot of all the active strings (reviewed or not) to be viewable with the certainty that it will remain untouched. This can be useful when maintaining multiple version of the same app.
version_create_form.copy_on_update_translation_help: Everytime a translation in this version is updated, the same text will be applied to the latest translation. This will make sure that a fix in frozen version will also be present in the latest version without any required actions by the developer or the reviewer.

version_update_form.title: Update version
version_update_form.copy_on_update_translation_help: Everytime a translation in this version is updated, the same text will be applied to the latest translation. This will make sure that a fix in frozen version will also be present in the latest version without any required actions by the developer or the reviewer.

project_file_operations.preview_text: You must choose a file, then click on the Preview button.

lint_translations_page.empty_text: No checks warnings or errors. You’re all good!

project_manage_languages.create_error: Language can not be added right now. Try again later.
project_manage_languages.conflicts_explain_text: All string addition or deletion will be reflected in the language. When a text changes in the main revision, the string in the language will be marked as in review.
project_manage_languages.sync_explain_text: The main language will be the default source when syncing a file. The other languages are never "synced", they just follow the main language.
project_manage_languages.add_translations_explain_text: All languages can have strings "merged" into it by adding translations. Conflict resolution will work the same but will never add or remove strings.
project_manage_languages.main_text: You can add a new language that will follow the main language.
project_manage_languages.title: Manage languages

placeholders.title: Placeholders
placeholders.text: These custom expressions mark special strings that will be replaced by dynamic values. You do not have to review or translate them.

checks.PLACEHOLDER_COUNT: Number of placeholders does not match the main string
checks.APOSTROPHE_AS_SINGLE_QUOTE: A single quote as been used instead of an apostrophe
checks.FIRST_LETTER_CASE: First letter of translation does not match case of the main’s
checks.THREE_DOTS_ELLIPSIS: String contains three dots instead of ellipsis
checks.SAME_TRAILING_CHARACTER: String does not match the trailing character of main
checks.URL_COUNT: Number of URL does not match the main string
